definition: lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]

sentences.english: These records used to send her .
sentences.chinese: 这些唱片过去往往使她听得如醉如痴。

sentences.english: The singer's beautiful voice enraptured the audience.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱家优美的歌声令听众如醉如痴。

sentences.english: In the open air their rapture broke into speech.
sentences.chinese: 来到户外，他们如醉如痴的狂喜迸发成语言。

sentences.english: All day long, Cosette remained in a sort of bewilderment.
sentences.chinese: 一整天，珂赛特都处在如醉如痴的状态中。

sentences.english: The Mole was bewitched, entranced, fascinated.
sentences.chinese: 鼹鼠如醉如痴，入神入迷。

sentences.english: The performance brought the audience to its feet.
sentences.chinese: 精彩的表演叫观众如醉如痴。

sentences.english: She charmed her listeners with her sweet voice.
sentences.chinese: 她甜润的嗓子使听众如醉如痴。

definition: lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
soul-stirring (of drama, poem or artwork)/heart-rending/deeply moving
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
